<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 905, 89]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the transfer of thermal energy from a beaker of hot water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 576, 120]]<|/det|>
Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 485, 152]]<|/det|>
Do **not** adjust the thermometer in the clamp.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[89, 160, 905, 393]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 409, 532, 428]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 441, 144, 459]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 441, 490, 459]]<|/det|>
Pour \(100 \text{cm}^3\) of hot water into beaker A.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 472, 774, 490]]<|/det|>
Place the thermometer in the water in beaker A by moving the clamp stand.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 503, 918, 536]]<|/det|>
In Table 1.1, record the temperature \(\theta\) of the water at time \(t = 0\) and immediately start the stopclock.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 551, 920, 583]]<|/det|>
Record, in Table 1.1, the temperature \(\theta\) of the water at times \(t = 30 \text{s}, 60 \text{s}, 90 \text{s}, 120 \text{s}, 150 \text{s}\) and \(180 \text{s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 597, 719, 615]]<|/det|>
Remove the thermometer from beaker A by moving the clamp stand.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 613, 920, 631]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 183, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|> Repeat the procedure in (a) for beaker B. Remove the lid before pouring the hot water into the beaker. Replace the lid immediately after pouring. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 84, 920, 103]]<|/det|> [2] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 116, 181, 135]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 116, 784, 135]]<|/det|> Complete the headings and the values in the time \(t\) column in Table 1.1. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 116, 920, 135]]<|/det|> [2] <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[457, 149, 539, 166]]<|/det|> Table 1.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 180, 744, 413]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 118, 920, 151]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 164, 920, 214]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 836, 89]]<|/det|>
A student investigates the factors that affect the average speed of a ball falling in water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment which will enable him to investigate the effect of **one** factor on the speed at which a ball of modelling clay falls in water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 522, 151]]<|/det|>
You are **not** required to carry out the experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 165, 398, 181]]<|/det|>
The apparatus available includes:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 196, 586, 212]]<|/det|>
modelling clay that can be made into different sized balls

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 211, 640, 227]]<|/det|>
metal ball bearings that can be embedded in the modelling clay

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 227, 470, 243]]<|/det|>
a long transparent tube, closed at one end

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 243, 263, 259]]<|/det|>
a supply of water

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 273, 324, 289]]<|/det|>
In your plan, you should:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 304, 490, 320]]<|/det|>
Â· state clearly the factor to be investigated

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 336, 457, 352]]<|/det|>
Â· list any additional apparatus needed

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 368, 517, 383]]<|/det|>
Â· state any key variables to be kept the same

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 399, 920, 430]]<|/det|>
Â· explain how to carry out the investigation, including the measurements to be made and any precautions that must be taken to ensure reliable results

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 445, 603, 461]]<|/det|>
Â· explain how to use the readings to reach a conclusion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 475, 576, 491]]<|/det|>
You may draw a diagram if it helps to explain your plan.
